title: Gender Violence
description: A friend of yours suffered an incident of domestic violence and asks you to help her with her children for a couple of weeks.
prompt: How do you want to help her?

options.description: Take time off work to help her
options.implicationText: 9% of migrants have to ask for help from the community. This serves to create a community network in Ecuador.

learn_more: According to the UN and Care Ecuador, gender violence is one of the most serious problems migrants suffer from in Ecuador.

title: Stay or Leave?
description: Unfortunately, you have not managed to integrate economically and socially into Ecuador. You decide to return to Venezuela in a few months.
prompt: What do you want to do?

options.description: Return to the border between Ecuador and Colombia
options.implicationText: A humanitarian organization pays for your passage to the border between Ecuador and Colombia. Due to your illegality, it decides to take irregular steps in order to cross the border. 23% of migrants return to Venezuela or Colombia due to not finding work.

options.description: Return to the border between Ecuador and Peru
options.implicationText: 48% of migrants decide to go to Peru.

learn_more: Other reasons why migrants decide to leave are housing (10%) and security (8%) problems.

title: Eviction
description: Your landlord decides to evict you for not paying your rent.
prompt: What do you want to do?

options.implicationText: You and your family move into one of the 50 shelters and welcome houses supported by the WFP in Ecuador. You have the right to a maximum of 5 days of assistance. All your needs will be covered during this time. 46% of the migrant population report poor accommodations and 9% report a lack of basic services.

options.description: Share a home with another family
options.implicationText: You decide to move into a private room with shared kitchens and sanitation/hygiene facilities. This option allows you to reduce your monthly expenses. 33% of the migrant population share their home with other family nuclei. 21% consider their bathrooms or showers unsafe.

learn_more: 51% of family groups have been forced to move since they arrived in Ecuador. 46% report having had problems with the owner of the house/room and 23% have suffered discrimination due to their nationality.
